item.title: Using System.in to choose from a list? help please :(
item.dc:creator: @Pezlam Pezlam
item.description:
@Pezlam wrote:

hi … im trying to make a server selector for the new client … at the moment i have this code below … and the other necessary bits of imports etc to go with it … but instead of the user typing the server prefix i was wondering if i could put in a list of prefixes for example when the user types Server: 1 into the cmd it chooses the correct prefix from the list for world 1 and places it into where “intServer” is located below… any ideas ? help at the moment would be great thanks Pez. (btw i have no idea if what ive attempted below will even work … probably get 5000 errors or something … ive only been learning java properly for about 2-3 hours thanks )
[Code]
int intServer;

            Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);

            System.out.print("Server: ");
            intServer = input.next();
    Class47_Sub8.aString1937 = " + intServer + ".runescape.com;
    client var_client = new client();
    var_client.method19(Class29.anInt649 + 32, 1, 765, "runescape",
			503, 462, 16);
} catch (Exception exception) {
    Class29.method252(exception, false, null);

[/Code]
